means: Optimum Vehicle for Effective Reconnaissance 有效侦察的最佳飞行器

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些前置词均含"在……上"之意。
means: above ：一般指位置高于某物，但不一定在正上方，也不接触另一物，其反义词是below。
on ：指与另一物表面相接触。
over ：指一物在另一物的垂直上方，多暗示悬空，但也含"覆盖于……之上"之意。其反义词是under。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些前置词均有"横过，穿过"之意。
means: across ：指"从……的一边到另一边"，强调横过，多与动态动词连用。
along ：指沿着一条直线在水平方向上运动。一般表动态，有时也与静态动词连用。
over ：常和动态动词连用，指"从……上面越过"或"横越"；表静态时，指"在彼处"。
through ：侧重从一端穿到另一端。

word_mean: over-speed protection device 离心机运行时，能把工作转速限制在该机或转头最高允许转速内的保护装置。
wintering ground 水产动物冬季栖息的水域。

sentence.Network_en: When the right woman comes along, this bad dream will be over.
sentence.Network_cn: 当有合适的女人出现时，这种胡思乱想就会停止了。

sentence.Network_en: Over a given period, the value of shares will rise and fall.
sentence.Network_cn: 股票的价值在某一特定的时期内会有涨跌。

sentence.Network_en: Dave, the pianist, played it over a couple of times.
sentence.Network_cn: 演奏钢琴的戴夫将这支曲子反复弹了两三遍。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 国家轴承精度等级对照表 ... 美国 USA 超过 over 到包括 incl.
单词忘不了全套资料免费下载更新了_百度文库 ... 〔him 他， 〔over 越过， 〔some 某一，.
闷油瓶_百度百科 ... San Shu 三叔 Over 结束（over） Pain 痛苦.
饮食英语词汇大全_专业词汇_专业英语_食品伙伴网 ... sunny side up 煎一面荷包蛋 over 煎两面荷包蛋 fried egg 煎蛋.

list.abs: 牛津高中版模块1... ... polish up 磨光，擦亮；提高，改进 over time 随着时间的过去，经过一段时间 centre around 以……为中心，围 …
一直想夺取take over中国领土的日本占领了东北三省。(强调划线部分)17. 人们了解.
高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... department n 部；局；处；科；部门；系 take over 接收：接管 electricity n 电；电学.
over spray 过喷涂 membrane system electro deposition 隔膜(电极)电泳涂装 over coating 重叠涂装 wet sanding with gasoline 汽油打磨 cathodic electro deposition.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... all of a sudden 突然 all over 遍及 all over again 再一次,重新.

jx.jx_cn_mean: 从…影响下恢复过来，渡过

lj.lj_ls: 我们渡过了最困难的一关。

jx.jx_en_mean: do or undergo something unpleasant or difficult, so as to be rid of it
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把（不愉快或难做的事）先做完

lj.lj_ly: exceptional service over and above what normally might be expected.
lj.lj_ls: 通常服务之外的特殊服务。

lj.lj_ly: Let's get the shopping over with. Are we over with all this shopping?
lj.lj_ls: 让我们购完物品。我们购到需要的物品了吗?

means.word_mean: 越过,在...对面,从一边到...的另一边,通过...的通讯途径
额外地,过分地,太,另外,也

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ofer, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch over and German über, from an Indo-European word (originally a comparative of the element represented by -ove in above) which is also the base of Latin super and Greek huper

encyclopedia.content: 简介 over， 英文单词，英标读eu ve。 做介词解，有在。.....上面，超过。...的，跨过（覆盖过）......的意思。 做副词解释，有结束的意思。 例句：The rainbow hangs over the river. 彩虹悬于河流之上。 A cloud moved over the city. 云朵飘过城市。 The Saints won over the Colts. 圣徒对赢过小马队。 The 2009 NFL season was over by Feb. 7.2009年国联赛季2月7日结束。 over也有结束的意思：同义词为 That's all 英英解释

usage_note.note: In addition to the uses shown below, over is used after some verbs, nouns, and adjectives in order to introduce extra information. Over is also used in phrasal verbs such as ‘hand over’ and ‘glaze over’.
usage_note.translation: 除下列用法外，over 用于某些动词、名词和形容词之后，引出附加信息。over还可用于hand over 和 glaze over 等短语动词中。

entry.tran: 在…的上方；在…的上面；在…的上空
entry.def: If one thing is over another thing or is moving over it, the first thing is directly above the second, either resting on it, or with a space between them.

example.ex: He looked at himself in the mirror over the table.
example.tran: 他对着桌子上方的镜子照了照。

example.ex: ...a bridge over the river Danube.
example.tran: 多瑙河上的一座桥

entry.def: If one thing is over another thing, it is supported by it and its ends are hanging down on each side of it.

example.ex: A grey mackintosh was folded over her arm...
example.tran: 她胳膊上搭着一件灰色雨衣。

example.ex: Joe's clothing was flung over the back of a chair.
example.tran: 乔的衣服扔在椅背上。

entry.tran: （部分或完全地）覆盖在…的上面
entry.def: If one thing is over another thing, it covers part or all of it.

example.ex: His hair fell over his brow instead of being brushed straight back...
example.tran: 他的头发没有整齐地往后梳，而是搭在前额。

example.ex: Mix the ingredients and pour over the mushrooms...
example.tran: 将配料搅拌均匀浇在蘑菇上。

entry.def: If you lean over an object, you bend your body so that the top part of it is above the object.

example.ex: They stopped to lean over a gate...
example.tran: 他们停下来，身子探过一扇栅栏门。

example.ex: Everyone in the room was bent over her desk.
example.tran: 房间里的每一个人都弯腰围在她的办公室桌前。

entry.tran: 从…上面（看过去）；隔着…（交谈）
entry.def: If you look over or talk over an object, you look or talk across the top of it.

example.ex: I went and stood beside him, looking over his shoulder.
example.tran: 我走过去站在他身边，从他的肩头望过去。

example.ex: ...conversing over the fence with your friend...
example.tran: 与你的朋友隔着围栏交谈

entry.def: If a window has a view over an area of land or water, you can see the land or water through the window.

example.ex: ...a light and airy bar with a wonderful view over the River Amstel...
example.tran: 可将阿姆斯特尔河美景尽收眼底的明亮通风的酒吧

example.ex: His rooms looked out over a narrow lane behind the college.
example.tran: 从他的房间可以看见学院后面一条狭窄的小巷。

entry.def: If someone or something goes over a barrier, obstacle, or boundary, they get to the other side of it by going across it, or across the top of it.

example.ex: Policemen jumped over the wall of the Spanish Embassy in pursuit...
example.tran: 警察在追捕中跳过西班牙大使馆的围墙。

example.ex: I stepped over a broken piece of wood...
example.tran: 我跨过一块破木头。

entry.def: If someone or something moves over an area or surface, they move across it, from one side to the other.

example.ex: She ran swiftly over the lawn to the gate...
example.tran: 她一溜烟穿过草地跑到了大门口。

example.ex: Joe passed his hand over his face and looked puzzled.
example.tran: 乔用手摸了一把脸，看上去疑惑不解。

entry.def: If something is on the opposite side of a road or river, you can say that it is over the road or river.

example.ex: ...Richard Garrick, who lived in the house over the road.
example.tran: 住在马路对面那所房子里的理查德·加里克

example.ex: ...a fashionable neighbourhood, just over the river from Manhattan.
example.tran: 与曼哈顿隔河相望的时尚街区

entry.def: If you go over to a place, you go to that place.

example.ex: I got out the car and drove over to Dervaig...
example.tran: 我把车开出来，驶向德韦格。

example.ex: I thought you might have invited her over.
example.tran: 我以为你可能已经邀请她过来了。

entry.def: You can use over to indicate a particular position or place a short distance away from someone or something.

example.ex: He noticed Rolfe standing silently over by the window...
example.tran: 他注意到罗尔夫一声不吭地站在窗户旁边。

example.ex: John reached over and took Joanna's hand...
example.tran: 约翰伸手握住乔安娜的手。

entry.def: You use over to say that someone or something falls towards or onto the ground, often suddenly or violently.

example.ex: If he drinks more than two glasses of wine he falls over...
example.tran: 他喝酒超过两杯就会醉倒在地。

example.ex: He was knocked over by a bus and broke his leg...
example.tran: 他被一辆公共汽车撞倒，一条腿折了。

entry.def: If something rolls over or is turned over, its position changes so that the part that was facing upwards is now facing downwards.

example.ex: His car rolled over after a tyre was punctured...
example.tran: 一只轮胎被扎破后，他的车翻了个底朝天。

example.ex: The alarm did go off but all I did was yawn, turn over and go back to sleep.
example.tran: 闹钟确实响了，但我只是打了个哈欠，翻个身又接着睡着了。

entry.def: All over a place means in every part of it.

example.ex: ...doctors who work all over the country.
example.tran: 在全国各地工作的医生

example.ex: ...the letters she received from people all over the world.
example.tran: 她收到的来自世界各地的信件

entry.tran: 在这边；到这边；在身处国
entry.def: Over here means near you, or in the country you are in.

example.ex: Why don't you come over here tomorrow evening...
example.tran: 你明天晚上过来吧。

example.ex: My father was in the U.S. army over here.
example.tran: 我父亲在这里的美国陆军服役。

entry.tran: 在那边；到那边；在另一国
entry.def: Over there means in a place a short distance away from you, or in another country.

example.ex: The cafe is just across the road over there...
example.tran: 咖啡馆就在那边马路对面。

example.ex: She'd married some American and settled down over there.
example.tran: 她嫁给了一位美国人，并在那边定居了。

entry.def: If something is over a particular amount, measurement, or age, it is more than that amount, measurement, or age.

example.ex: Cigarettes kill over a hundred thousand Britons every year...
example.tran: 每年香烟夺去10万多英国人的生命。

example.ex: I met George well over a year ago.
example.tran: 我认识乔治已经是一年多前的事了。

entry.tran: 多于（正常数量）；除了…之外（还）
entry.def: Over and above an amount, especially a normal amount, means more than that amount or in addition to it.

example.ex: Expenditure on education has gone up by seven point eight per cent over and above inflation...
example.tran: 扣除通货膨胀因素，教育支出实际增长了7.8%。

example.ex: Consider supplements over and above this healthy diet.
example.tran: 除了这种健康饮食之外，还应考虑各种补养品。

entry.def: If you say that you have some food or money over, you mean that it remains after you have used all that you need.

example.ex: Larsons pay me well enough, but there's not much over for luxuries when there's two of you to live on it...
example.tran: 拉森公司给我的薪水算是不错，但是两个人靠这份工资生活便没有多少闲钱买奢侈品了。

example.ex: Primrose was given an apple, left over from our picnic lunch.
example.tran: 我们中午野餐剩下的一个苹果给了普丽姆罗丝。

entry.def: If you do something over, you do it again or start doing it again from the beginning.

example.ex: She said if she had the chance to do it over, she would have hired a press secretary...
example.tran: 她说如果有机会从头来过，她会雇一位新闻秘书。

example.ex: Dave, the pianist, played it over a couple of times.
example.tran: 演奏钢琴的戴夫将这支曲子反复弹了两三遍。

entry.tran: （强调发生不止一次）两次/三次
entry.def: If you say that something happened twice over ,three times over and so on, you are stating the number of times that it happened and emphasizing that it happened more than once.

example.ex: He had to have everything spelled out twice over for him.
example.tran: 他不得不把所有事项都对他详细说明了两次。

entry.def: If you do something over again, you do it again or start doing it again from the beginning.

example.ex: When you realise they are singing the same songs over again, the novelty wears off...
example.tran: 当你意识到他们开始从头演唱同样的歌曲时，新鲜感也就没有了。

example.ex: If I was living my life over again I wouldn't have attended so many committee meetings.
example.tran: 如果生命可以重来，我再也不会参加这么多委员会会议了。

entry.tran: （指令人疲倦、厌烦、不快地）再一次，又一次，重新
entry.def: If you say that something is happening all over again, you are emphasizing that it is happening again, and you are suggesting that it is tiring, boring, or unpleasant.

example.ex: He doesn't want the hassle all over again...
example.tran: 他不想再惹这种麻烦了。

example.ex: The whole process started all over again...
example.tran: 整个程序又再次开始了。

entry.def: If you say that something happened over and over or over and over again, you are emphasizing that it happened many times.

example.ex: He plays the same songs over and over...
example.tran: 他一遍又一遍地放着同样的歌曲。

example.ex: 'I don't understand it,' he said, over and over again.
example.tran: “我不明白，”他反复不停地说。

entry.def: If an activity is over or all over, it is completely finished.

example.ex: Warplanes that have landed there will be kept until the war is over...
example.tran: 降落在那里的战斗机将一直扣留到战争结束。

example.ex: The bad times were over...
example.tran: 倒霉的日子过去了。

entry.tran: 从（某一疾病或经历）中恢复过来
entry.def: If you are over an illness or an experience, it has finished and you have recovered from its effects.

example.ex: I'm glad that you're over the flu...
example.tran: 你的流感好了，我真高兴。

example.ex: She was still getting over the shock of what she had been told.
example.tran: 她被告知了这件事，直到现在还惊魂未定。

entry.def: If you have control or influence over someone or something, you are able to control them or influence them.

example.ex: He's never had any influence over her...
example.tran: 他从未对她有过任何影响力。

example.ex: For two decades she has sought complete control over her film career...
example.tran: 她20年来一直力图完全主宰自己的电影事业。

entry.def: You use over to indicate what a disagreement or feeling relates to or is caused by.

example.ex: The women were making a fuss over nothing.
example.tran: 这些女人是在无谓地小题大做。

example.ex: ...concern over recent events in Burma...
example.tran: 对缅甸近期所发生事件的关注

entry.def: If something happens over a particular period of time or over something such as a meal, it happens during that time or during the meal.

example.ex: The number of attacks on the capital had gone down over the past week...
example.tran: 上一周对首都的袭击次数已经减少了。

example.ex: Many strikes over the last few years have not ended successfully...
example.tran: 过去几年中有多次罢工都未获成功。

entry.def: You use over to indicate that you give or receive information using a telephone, radio, or other piece of electrical equipment.

example.ex: I'm not prepared to discuss this over the telephone...
example.tran: 我不想在电话里讨论这件事。

example.ex: The head of state addressed the nation over the radio...
example.tran: 这位国家元首通过广播向全国发表了讲话。

entry.tran: （广播或电视节目中的主持人用语）下面交给…
entry.def: The presenter of a radio or television programme says 'over to someone' to indicate the person who will speak next.

example.ex: With the rest of the sports news, over to Colin Maitland.
example.tran: 下面由科林·梅特兰接着为大家播报其他体育新闻。

entry.tran: （无线电通讯用语）完毕，请回答
entry.def: When people such as the police or the army are using a radio to communicate, they say 'Over' to indicate that they have finished speaking and are waiting for a reply.

entry.tran: （板球运动中）一轮6个（未让对方得分的）有效投球
entry.def: In cricket, an over consists of six correctly bowled balls.

example.ex: At the start of the last over, bowled by Chris Lewis, the Welsh county were favourites.
example.tran: 在最后一轮由克里斯·刘易斯连续投出6个有效球之前，威尔士郡队本来胜券在握。

means.word_mean: 1. (cricket) the period during which a given number of balls (6 in England but 8 in Australia) are bowled at the batsman by one player from the other team from the same end of the pitch
1. having come or been brought to a conclusion;
1. at or to a point across intervening space etc.;

sentences.sentence: "come over and see us some time"

means.word_mean: 3. in such a manner as to be understood and accepted;

list.explanation: 受制于人，处于不利地位，一筹莫展

example.en: I knew enough about him that I had him over a barrel.
example.zh: 我对他的底细一清二铯，所以我能把他完全控制在手中。

example.en: He made money hand over fist by acting.

list.explanation: 周详地考虑或斟酌(某事)

example.en: He is cooling your suggestion over.
example.zh: 他正在周详地考虑你的建议。

list.explanation: 不能自拔，五体投地，深深地

example.en: She's so beautiful she'll knock you ass over tincups.
example.zh: 她真漂亮得可叫你神魂颠倒。

example.en: After a going over like that，the guy spent two weeks in the hospital.
example.zh: 挨了 那样一顿痛打后，那家伙住了两个星期医院。

example.en: I gave your car a good going over, and I fixed a lot of little things.
example.zh: 我把你的车仔细检查了一下，修好了许多小东西。

list.explanation: 令人恐惧的，精疲力竭的，悲惨凄苦的，像死人一般的0h, my God! You look like death warmed over! 啊，我的天!你的脸色好吓人!

example.en: A tall, black-garbed gentleman lay there, looking like death warmed up.
example.zh: 那儿躺了一个高个子穿黑衣服的绅士，看上去像死人一般。

slang.tokens: go over like a lead balloon

example.en: The joke went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 这笑话说得一点也不好笑。

example.en: My appeal to his better nature went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 我求他发发善心，结果是白费劲。

example.en: Where did you get all those watches? Did you knock them over?
example.zh: 所有那些手表你都足从哪里摘来的？偷来的？

example.en: The cops knocked over a reputed bookmakitig parlor.
example.zh: 警察突然査抄了一家名气很响的马票经纪所。

list.explanation: (支付、价格等)超出预期的，高于必需的，过多的

example.en: He got two pounds over the odds for his job.
example.zh: 按他的活几来说,他多得了两英镑。

list.explanation: (行为、事件等)超出人们所能忍受的，不公平的，不合理的

example.en: I admit that to be called a damned Englishman by Pedro Gonsalvez is a bit over the odds.
example.zh: 我承认，被彼德罗·罔萨尔维兹骂作一个他妈的英国人是相当叫人难以容忍的。
他出来了。越狱逃出来的。

auth_sentence.content: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.
auth_sentence.res_content: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Within a couple of weeks the rebellion was over.

auth_sentence.content: How obsessed have you become over a loved one?
auth_sentence.res_content: How obsessed have you become over a loved one?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How obsessed have you become over a loved one?

auth_sentence.content: The ball is sent over by Rafael Da Silva.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ball is sent over by Rafael Da Silva.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ball is sent over by Rafael Da Silva.

means.word_mean: (表示位置)在…的正上方; 在…的上面; 在…的上空

sentences.en: There is a lamp over the table.
sentences.cn: 桌子正上方有一盏灯。

sentences.en: The clouds are right over us.
sentences.cn: 现在云正在我们的头顶上。

means.word_mean: (表示位置)遍布在…上面, 扩展到…全部

sentences.en: A smile came over her face.
sentences.cn: 她的脸上露出了笑容。

sentences.en: Brilliant light poured over me.
sentences.cn: 耀眼的光洒遍我的全身。

means.word_mean: (表示方向)越过, 从一边至…的另一边

sentences.en: Instead of opening the gate, we climbed over it.
sentences.cn: 我们没有开门, 而是从门顶上爬过去的。

sentences.en: We moved through fields and over ditches.
sentences.cn: 我们穿过田野, 跨过沟渠。

sentences.en: The weight of the net pulled him over the edge and into the sea.
sentences.cn: 沉重的鱼网把他拖下崖边坠入海中。

means.word_mean: (表示等级或数目)高于; 在…之上, 超过

sentences.en: I am not in charge of the department; I have two people over me.
sentences.cn: 我不是这个部门的主管, 我还有两位上级。

means.word_mean: (表示时间或过程)在…期间; 在从事…的时候

sentences.en: Will you be at home over Christmas?
sentences.cn: 你圣诞节期间在家吗?

sentences.en: The leaders met over informal lunches.
sentences.cn: 领袖们在非正式午餐时进行会晤。

sentences.en: They discussed it over a game of golf.
sentences.cn: 他们一边打高尔夫球, 一边讨论。

sentences.en: These men have quarreled over the price of a load of hay.
sentences.cn: 这帮人为了一车干草的价钱争吵不休。

sentences.en: She knocked the vase over.
sentences.cn: 她碰倒了花瓶。

means.word_mean: 从一边至另一边, 从一方至另一方

sentences.en: Let's change these two pictures over.
sentences.cn: 我们把两张画对调一下位置。

sentences.en: We rowed over to the other side of the river.
sentences.cn: 我们划船到河的对岸。

sentences.en: I have read the paper over.
sentences.cn: 我把报纸全部看完了。

sentences.en: I have looked all over for him.
sentences.cn: 我到处都找过他了。

sentences.en: My sums were wrong and I had to do them over.
sentences.cn: 我的总数错了, 只好再算一遍。

sentences.en: She is over polite.
sentences.cn: 她太客气了。

sentences.en: He was over nervous.
sentences.cn: 他太紧张了。

sentences.en: The war was all over.
sentences.cn: 战争结束了。

sentences.en: His suffering will soon be over.
sentences.cn: 他的苦难就要结束了。

sentences.en: Over 20 metres or so, there's a telephone-box there.
sentences.cn: 再走二十几米，那里有一个电话亭。

sentences.en: Has he overed from his fury?
sentences.cn: 他这会儿平静下来了吗?

jushi.english: We drove over the new throughway.
jushi.chinese: 我们沿着那条新的直达公路行驶。

jushi.english: A smile came over her face.
He couldn't enter for the examination because he was over age.
